body_html:
@fabio12345 When using dilation_rate = 4 and padding="SAME", the width and height of your image have to be divisible by 4. You'll have to pad, crop, or reshape example_image2. Something like:

import tensorflow as tf
example_image = tf.zeros([1, 32, 32, 1])
example_image2 = tf.zeros([1, 41, 41, 1])
example_image2_resized = tf.image.resize_images(example_image2, [40, 40])

convolution_op = tf.layers.Conv2D(32, 3, padding="SAME", dilation_rate=4)
convolution_op(example_image)
convolution_op(example_image2_resized)
body_text:
@fabio12345 When using dilation_rate = 4 and padding="SAME", the width and height of your image have to be divisible by 4. You'll have to pad, crop, or reshape example_image2. Something like:
import tensorflow as tf
example_image = tf.zeros([1, 32, 32, 1])
example_image2 = tf.zeros([1, 41, 41, 1])
example_image2_resized = tf.image.resize_images(example_image2, [40, 40])

convolution_op = tf.layers.Conv2D(32, 3, padding="SAME", dilation_rate=4)
convolution_op(example_image)
convolution_op(example_image2_resized)
body:
@fabio12345 When using `dilation_rate = 4` and `padding="SAME"`, the width and height of your image have to be divisible by 4. You'll have to pad, crop, or reshape `example_image2`. Something like:

```python
import tensorflow as tf
example_image = tf.zeros([1, 32, 32, 1])
example_image2 = tf.zeros([1, 41, 41, 1])
example_image2_resized = tf.image.resize_images(example_image2, [40, 40])

convolution_op = tf.layers.Conv2D(32, 3, padding="SAME", dilation_rate=4)
convolution_op(example_image)
convolution_op(example_image2_resized)
```
